Description: Body sherd (mended from numerous fragments) of Chian pottery patterned chalice with handle roots and conical foot; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (and worn) below, save reserved dot in centre of bowl; exterior: lip reserved; bands on either side of handle zone; in handle zone, trace of double saw-edged metope pattern between groups of vertical strokes; handles glazed; below, on cul, single brown band; outside of foot glazed.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 231, no. 64)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 19 F, pl. X, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0324) (phase 2)
